verses.plain: The song of songs, which is Solomon’s.

tokens.t: The song of songs, which
Solomon’s.

verses.plain: Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth: for thy love is better than wine.

tokens.t: Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth: for thy love
better than wine.

verses.plain: Because of the savour of thy good ointments thy name is as ointment poured forth, therefore do the virgins love thee.

tokens.t: Because of the savour of thy good ointments thy name
ointment poured forth, therefore do the virgins love thee.

verses.plain: Draw me, we will run after thee: the king hath brought me into his chambers: we will be glad and rejoice in thee, we will remember thy love more than wine: the upright love thee.

tokens.t: Draw me, we will run after thee: the king hath brought me into his chambers: we will be glad and rejoice in thee, we will remember thy love more than wine: the upright love thee.

verses.plain: I am black, but comely, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, as the tents of Kedar, as the curtains of Solomon.

tokens.t: I
black, but comely, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, as the tents of Kedar, as the curtains of Solomon.

verses.plain: Look not upon me, because I am black, because the sun hath looked upon me: my mother’s children were angry with me; they made me the keeper of the vineyards; but mine own vineyard have I not kept.

tokens.t: Look not upon me, because I
black, because the sun hath looked upon me: my mother’s children were angry with me; they made me the keeper of the vineyards;
mine own vineyard have I not kept.

verses.plain: Tell me, O thou whom my soul loveth, where thou feedest, where thou makest thy flock to rest at noon: for why should I be as one that turneth aside by the flocks of thy companions?

tokens.t: Tell me, O thou whom my soul loveth, where thou feedest, where thou makest
to rest at noon: for why should I be as one that turneth aside by the flocks of thy companions?

verses.plain: ¶ If thou know not, O thou fairest among women, go thy way forth by the footsteps of the flock, and feed thy kids beside the shepherds’ tents.

tokens.t: ¶ If thou know not, O thou fairest among women, go thy way forth by the footsteps of the flock, and feed thy kids beside the shepherds’ tents.

verses.plain: I have compared thee, O my love, to a company of horses in Pharaoh’s chariots.

tokens.t: I have compared thee, O my love, to a company of horses in Pharaoh’s chariots.

verses.plain: Thy cheeks are comely with rows of jewels, thy neck with chains of gold.

tokens.t: Thy cheeks are comely with rows
, thy neck with chains

verses.plain: We will make thee borders of gold with studs of silver.

tokens.t: We will make thee borders of gold with studs of silver.

verses.plain: ¶ While the king sitteth at his table, my spikenard sendeth forth the smell thereof.

tokens.t: ¶ While the king
at his table, my spikenard sendeth forth the smell thereof.

verses.plain: A bundle of myrrh is my wellbeloved unto me; he shall lie all night betwixt my breasts.

tokens.t: A bundle of myrrh
my wellbeloved unto me; he shall lie all night betwixt my breasts.

verses.plain: My beloved is unto me as a cluster of camphire in the vineyards of En-gedi.

tokens.t: My beloved
unto me
a cluster of camphire in the vineyards of En-gedi.

verses.plain: Behold, thou art fair, my love; behold, thou art fair; thou hast doves’ eyes.

tokens.t: Behold, thou
fair, my love; behold, thou
fair; thou
doves’ eyes.

verses.plain: Behold, thou art fair, my beloved, yea, pleasant: also our bed is green.

tokens.t: Behold, thou
fair, my beloved, yea, pleasant: also our bed
green.

verses.plain: The beams of our house are cedar, and our rafters of fir.

tokens.t: The beams of our house
cedar,
our rafters of fir.

footnotes.text: the upright…: or, they love thee uprightly
as one…: or, as one that is veiled
